title: feat: add support for unstable-msc3931/3932 style push conditions parsing
body:
Seeing 
```
:WARN :matrix_sdk_base::client:crates/matrix-sdk-base/src/client.rs:529:Failed to deserialize a global account data event error=Error("unknown variant `org.matrix.msc3931.room_version_supports`, expected one of `event_match`, `contains_display_name`, `room_member_count`, `sender_notification_permission`", line: 1, column: 1018)
```

because the server sends 3931 field values we don't have support for yet. This PR adds support for it behind another `unstable-`-flag. Not sure if we need/want to have another fallback support in case the flag is not activated.

Closes #1431.







<!-- Replace -->
----
Preview: https://pr-1405--ruma-docs.surge.sh
<!-- Replace -->

title: events: Remove Serialize impls for all event types except ToDeviceEvent
body:
This requires some changes before it works in matrix-rust-sdk, but otherwise it's ready.

The reason for doing this is that it is a feature encourages doing serde roundtrips of events, which is not a good idea. There are very few to no "proper" uses of it:

- Clients only need to serialize event content types, not full events
- Servers need event types with raw content, so they don't fall into the same trap of first fully deserializing user content before embedding it in events and thus loosing unknown fields




<!-- Replace -->
----
Preview Removed
<!-- Replace -->

By de-duplicating the code this fixes an issue that was in the `encrypted::Thread` constructors, but not in the `message::Thread` constructors.

title: Add request attribute macro
body:
Part of #1348.

I made `ruma_api!` emit the new attribute to validate that it works, but this will make compile times worse (extra roundtrip through the compiler parsing the macro output and then re-serializing it to pass it onto the next macro). I guess that is fine because we should be able to convert everything before the next release.

I re-instantiated the `error = Type` thing for the derive macros because I think `#[request(error = crate::Error)]` is cleaner than the macros depending on there being an `ErrorTy` type alias in scope.




<!-- Replace -->
----
Preview Removed
<!-- Replace -->
